The most stirring of these 75 or so objects in this immigration show is Erkan Ozgen's video of a 13-year-old Syrian boy describing the bombing of his town, seeing neighbors being killed, going without food, water - the horror of it.
He's not speaking a word.
He's deaf and mute, so he's using hand language to tell the story.
And somehow taking the words out of this story made it all the more powerful.
It's a short video, yet the impact is immense.
I think it is one of the most powerful pieces because it's hard to watch, and it's hard to not watch.

I do, before it's over, and realize that's what we do now - turn from the terrible realities of this global displacement we're living through.
